TITLE: U.K. to supply tanks as Russian missiles hit across Ukraine

TITLE: Mother, 3 children dead following Indiana house fire

TITLE: China reports 60,000 COVID-related deaths, says peak passed
SUMMARY: China stopped reporting data on COVID-19 deaths and infections after abruptly lifting anti-virus controls in early December despite a surge in infections that began in October

TITLE: Clouded leopard who escaped at Dallas Zoo is found after enclosure was cut, police say
SUMMARY: Police said Saturday a cut similar to the one in the leopard's enclosure fence was found at the habitat for a breed of monkey. It's unclear if the two incidents are related

SUMMARY: Doctors successfully separated conjoined twin girls in a miracle procedure at Cook Children’s Medical Center in Fort Worth, Texas. NBC News’ Sam Brock reports on the parents’ overjoyed reaction

SUMMARY: In its opening statement in the Alex Murdaugh murder trial, the state contends that new evidence contradicts Murdaugh’s alibi. However, his attorney argues there’s no forensic evidence to tie him to the murders. NBC News’ Catie Beck has more details about the case

SUMMARY: The coroner's office released a full list of the victims' names Tuesday. Among them was Star Ballroom Dance Studio’s Ming Wei Ma, whom a friend described as “always welcoming

SUMMARY: The move came hours after the teacher's attorney said school administrators "failed to act" despite warnings from multiple teachers hours before the shooting

TITLE: Teacher shot by 6-year-old texted a dire warning to a loved one before she was wounded, source says
SUMMARY: The text “showed her frustration,” the source said. “She was frustrated because she was trying to get help with this child, for this child, and then when she needed help, no one was coming

SUMMARY: The district attorney said the incident, in which a 5-year-old girl and a 3-old-boy were killed and a 7-month-old boy was injured, was "an unimaginable, senseless tragedy

SUMMARY: The meltdown at Southwest Airlines last month led to thousands of canceled flights, stranded passengers and lost luggage

TITLE: Connecticut's first LGBTQ-centered school to open later this year
SUMMARY: As lawmakers continue to debate LGBTQ representation in U.S. schools, Connecticut’s PROUD Academy plans to open its doors to queer youths and allies this fall

SUMMARY: At-home brain stimulation is flourishing among a group of enthusiasts, who say it gives them a mental edge. The science behind why it may work is still in the early stages

SUMMARY: The Arctic air included a record-setting wind chill of minus 108 degrees Fahrenheit on the summit of Mount Washington in New Hampshire

TITLE: Fallout from suspected spy balloon kills 'huge propaganda win' for China

TITLE: Video appears to show Chinese spy balloon being downed
SUMMARY: NBC News speaks to Lisa Roberts, a witness in South Carolina, who filmed the Chinese spy balloon appearing to fall from the sky, and explains the moment she believed to have seen the balloon being shot down from her home.&nbsp

TITLE: Court to reconsider Connecticut's transgender athlete policy
SUMMARY: A federal appeals court will rehear a challenge to the state's policy of letting trans girls compete on female sports teams after it was upheld by a three-judge panel

TITLE: White House speaks on unidentified objects being shot down
SUMMARY: The White House said today that those unidentified objects shot down last week could be for benign commercial or academic research. NBC News’ Andrea Mitchell reports more on how members of Congress are responding

TITLE: Michigan State students take comfort in one another amid deadly shooting
SUMMARY: “I live at MSU, and I shouldn’t be scared to walk out of my front door, but from now on I will be," one student said

SUMMARY: Mike Long is a songwriter, creating ballads about ordinary, everyday people. He charges about $300 per song and spends more than 20 hours on each composition. NBC News’ Gadi Schwartz shares more about his work

SUMMARY: Three students were killed and five critically wounded in a shooting on Michigan State University's campus. The 43-year-old suspect had no known connection to MSU and took his own life hours after the shooting, according to police. NBC News’ Maggie Vespa has the latest updates

TITLE: Black patients face historically longer waiting times for kidney transplants due to outdated test
SUMMARY: Historically, Black patients have had to wait longer for kidney transplants than other races, in part because of an outdated test that overestimated their kidney function. Now, a new national rule will remove the test, which is seen as racially bias, in determining who gets a transplant. NBC News’ Yamiche Alcindor shares more

TITLE: 4 men arrested in the U.S. in assassination of Haitian President Jovenel Moïse
SUMMARY: 11 people face charges in Southern Florida in connection with the investigation into Moïse's 2021 death, which unleashed chaos in the small Caribbean country

TITLE: Missouri man accused of holding woman in basement for weeks could face 5 life sentences

TITLE: Ahead of Buffalo shooter's sentencing, residents reflect on returning to Tops store
SUMMARY: “This is my store. I have no hesitation,” said one customer, Robert Archie. "You just hope that something else like that doesn’t happen again

TITLE: West Virginia MMA fighters volunteer as security for local drag show
SUMMARY: The mixed martial artists volunteered their services after threats led to the cancellation of a local restaurant’s drag brunch

TITLE: Historic winter storm hitting some of California’s major cities

SUMMARY: There was another close runway call at Burbank Airport in California, making it the fourth this year. NBC News’ Tom Costello on how the FAA and NTSB are responding amid the recent cluster of “runway incursions

TITLE: Mississippi wants to expand an aggressive police force responsible for recent shootings
SUMMARY: The Mississippi Capitol Police operates in Jackson but is outside of the city’s control, leaving much of its work opaque.&nbsp

SUMMARY: Seong Cho was with backcountry travelers on Colchuck Peak when the ground shifted. Two other climbers, Jeannie Lee and Yun Park, are presumed dead and have not been found

SUMMARY: Ramon Escobar was convicted of killing seven people, including his uncle and aunt

TITLE: One arrested in Texas dog attack that left an 81-year-old man dead

SUMMARY: The diet company hopes to offer members the ability to meet with clinicians who can prescribe obesity and diabetes medications

TITLE: Federal safety board to investigate Norfolk Southern after train derailments

TITLE: A woman who was found dead in Massachusetts nearly 45 years ago has finally been identified
SUMMARY: Patricia Ann Tucker, 28, was found buried under leaves off a road in the town of Granby on Nov. 15, 1978, investigators said at a news conference Monday. She had been shot in the head. For decades, she was known only as “Granby Girl

SUMMARY: Spirit agreed to sell itself to JetBlue last summer after a long battle for the carrier between JetBlue and Frontier Airlines

SUMMARY: As California deals with historic snowfall, there is growing desperation to reach those stranded in the mountains 80 miles outside of Los Angeles. NBC News’ Miguel Almaguer has the latest on the extreme weather and residents’ growing concern

TITLE: 14-year-old boy nicknamed 'El Chapito' arrested for the murder of 8 people near Mexico City
SUMMARY: The motive in the killings has not been made public, but drug gangs in Mexico frequently dabble in kidnapping and contract killing

TITLE: Illinois prison guard gets 20 years for inmate beating death
SUMMARY: Following a four-week trial, a jury convicted Alex Banta in April 2022 of conspiracy to deprive civil rights, deprivation of civil rights, obstruction of an investigation, falsification of documents and misleading conduct

TITLE: Derek Chauvin, ex-officer convicted of killing George Floyd, pleads guilty to federal tax evasion
SUMMARY: The onetime Minneapolis police officer is already behind bars for Floyd's death, a murder that sparked a summer of civil rights protests across America

TITLE: YouTube lifts restrictions on Trump’s account
SUMMARY: The decision means that Trump’s accounts on three major platforms from which he was suspended or restricted are now restored

TITLE: Farmworkers lead 5-day march to pressure companies on wages, work conditions
SUMMARY: The Florida-based Coalition of Immokalee Workers hoped to use the march to pressure other large companies to join the Fair Food Program for better work conditions and wages

SUMMARY: The largest of two recalls covers nearly 1.3 million 2013 through 2018 Ford Fusion and Lincoln MKX midsize cars

TITLE: Great-grandmother kidnapped and held for ransom in Mexico
SUMMARY: Another U.S. citizen was kidnapped and is being held for ransom in Mexico. The great-grandmother’s family is pleading for help to get her back. NBC News’ Gabe Gutierrez has more details on the FBI’s investigation

SUMMARY: California’s parade of atmospheric rivers has left the region in a state of mayhem and misery, however, they are also helping to alleviate many years of severe drought in the state. TITLE: DOJ, FBI investigating TikTok’s parent company ByteDance
SUMMARY: The Justice Department and the FBI are now looking into whether Chinese company ByteDance illegally surveilled journalists, according to a law enforcement official with knowledge of the matter. NBC News’ Hallie Jackson has more details on TikTok’s future in the U.S

SUMMARY: Residents in Rolling Fork and Silver City, Mississippi were devastated by a tornado and are desperate for help. SUMMARY: A 28-year-old fatally shot three children and three adults at a private elementary school in Nashville, Tennessee, authorities say. NBC News’ Kathy Park has more details on how the shooter got into the school

SUMMARY: A Utah skier says the actor slammed into him and caused serious injuries in 2016, but Paltrow says she was the one who was hit

TITLE: Losing weight is good for the heart, even if you regain some of it
SUMMARY: The health benefits of weight loss persisted even when people gained some of their weight back

SUMMARY: Body camera video from officers who encountered the shooter, whom police identified as Audrey Hale, 28, during the attack, is also expected to be released

TITLE: Utah avalanche sparks shelter-in-place order at ski resort
SUMMARY: Snowbird, a mountain resort in Little Cottonwood Canyon southeast of Salt Lake City, said that after an hourslong search, "no guests or employees were caught in the debris caused by an avalanche" on Thursday

SUMMARY: For short-term weight loss, drugs like semaglutide aren't the answer

SUMMARY: The White House has released a new report into the U.S. withdrawal from Afghanistan, blaming decisions that the Trump administration made for the chaos that unfolded at Kabul International Airport in August 2021. TITLE: Justice Thomas accepted trips from GOP donor, report says
SUMMARY: According to an article released by ProPublica, Supreme Court Justice Clarence Thomas accepted luxury trips from conservative billionaire Harlan Crow without disclosing them. NBC News’ Lawrence Hurley explains what ethical concerns are raised in the report and whether Thomas has responded to the claims.&nbsp

SUMMARY: The U.S. economy added 236,000 jobs in the month of March, lower than the previous month, with the unemployment rate dipping slightly to 3.5% according to the Bureau of Labor Statistics jobs report. NBC's Brian Cheung and Caleb Silver break down the report

SUMMARY: Mars’ lawsuit alleges that the group — particularly Nikki Sixx, had a pattern of belittling him for years, telling him he had cognitive issues and insulting him about alleged poor playing on tour, including a stadium outing he completed with the band in 2022

TITLE: WWE apologizes for using Auschwitz footage in pro WrestleMania promo
SUMMARY: The pro wrestling body said it moved quickly after learning about the offensive gaffe, adding: "We apologize for this error

TITLE: FDA authorizes 2nd dose of updated Covid booster for older adults
SUMMARY: People 65 and up can get a second dose of the updated booster at least four months after their last dose

TITLE: Florida boat captain killed and passenger injured after lightning appears to strike boat
SUMMARY: The captain killed was identified as 39-year-old Peter Strong of West Melbourne, the Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission said

TITLE: N.Y. man is accused of fatally shooting woman who pulled into the wrong driveway

TITLE: Former NFL defensive end Chris Smith dies at 31
SUMMARY: No details regarding the circumstances of Smith's death were shared. Smith played a total of eight seasons in the NFL and signed to the XFL Seattle Sea Dragons in March

TITLE: Buffalo Bills safety Damar Hamlin medically cleared to resume playing after on-field cardiac arrest
SUMMARY: Hamlin collapsed after making what appeared to be a routine tackle in the Jan. 2 game against the Cincinnati Bengals, which was suspended and eventually canceled

TITLE: Texas teacher charged after allegedly encouraging students to fight in classroom
SUMMARY: A Mesquite, Texas, substitute teacher has been fired and is facing charges after allegedly staging student fights in her classroom. NBC News’ Gary Grumbach reports

SUMMARY: Corden announced one year ago that he would be ending his late-night show after eight seasons, citing a desire to return to his native U.K. to be closer to family and loved ones

TITLE: Former Vice President Pence testifies before Jan. 6 grand jury
SUMMARY: Mike Pence testified before a federal grand jury looking into the January 6 Capitol riot just one day after a federal appeals court rejected former President Trump’s attempts to block the former vice president’s testimony. TITLE: Trump takes aim at Biden during New Hampshire campaign rally
SUMMARY: Former President Trump held his first major campaign event in New Hampshire since President Biden announced his re-election campaign earlier this week. NBC News’ Vaughn Hillyard breaks down the key takeaways from Trump’s speech

TITLE: DOJ sues Tennessee over ban on care for transgender youth
SUMMARY: The Justice Department has filed a lawsuit challenging a Tennessee law which bans doctors from providing gender-affirming care to transgender youth. NBC News legal analyst Danny Cevallos breaks down how the Justice Department’s lawsuit could impact the new law taking effect and whether it could have an impact on other states that are trying to pass similar laws.&nbsp

TITLE: Missing Ohio EMT found alive, police say
SUMMARY: Lachelle Jordan, 30, was found on the 16600 block of Euclid Avenue and was taken to a hospital for treatment, Cleveland police said

TITLE: 16 million in Midwest and Great Plains bracing for severe weather
SUMMARY: 16 million people across the Midwest and Great Plains are bracing for severe weather. NBC News’ Blayne Alexander has the latest storm updates

TITLE: Title 42’s end drawing record number of illegal border crossings
SUMMARY: Following Title 42’s end, the U.S. is experiencing an all-time high rate of illegal border crossings. Now an investigation is underway to figure out how a migrant child died at a federally contracted facility in Florida. NBC News’ Tom Llamas has the latest

SUMMARY: In January, Frank Ferrara stopped by a Delaware ACME and suffered a cardiac arrest. Two nearby shoppers who happened to be nurses performed CPR until paramedics arrived. Now, Ferrara has the chance to say thank you to them in-person. NBC News’ Emilie Ikeda shares the story

TITLE: Lori Vallow Daybell found guilty of killing her two kids and conspiring to kill husband’s first wife
SUMMARY: An Idaho jury found Lori Vallow Daybell guilty of killing her two children and conspiracy in the death of her husband’s first wife. NBC News’ Gabe Gutierrez has more details on the trial

SUMMARY: Hours after Title 42 was lifted, shelters in El Paso, Texas are facing growing numbers of migrants released into the U.S. NBC News’ Julia Ainsley is at one shelter tonight

TITLE: 'Revenge blocking' is becoming a popular trend in dating apps
SUMMARY: Dating apps have become one of the most popular forms of meeting romantic partners, but now users are using a functionality within the software to block and get other users kicked off of the platform entirely. NBC's Rehema Ellis reports.&nbsp

TITLE: Youtuber whose plane crashed agrees to plead guilty to staging incident
SUMMARY: 29-year-old Youtuber Trevor Jacob agreed to plead guilty to a felony charge but has not done so yet after federal authorities say he staged a plane crash. They say he did it for the sake of making a video that has racked up more than three million views. NBC News’ Gadi Schwartz has more details

TITLE: Non-profit providing critical doula services to Black women cost-free
SUMMARY: Black women are three times more likely to die from a pregnancy-related cause than white women. The non-profit “Parents as Teachers” is trying to change that by providing doula services to families cost-free. NBC News’ Zinhle Essamuah reports

TITLE: Warner Bros. Discovery CEO booed at Boston University graduation amid writers strike
SUMMARY: Videos circulating on social media appeared to show BU students chanting “Pay your writers” during David Zaslav's speech on Sunday

TITLE: Girl, 8, and boy, 4, dead after getting swept away in strong California river current
SUMMARY: The pair were with their mother at the Kings River, which has been closed to recreational users since March due to high water levels

TITLE: Student, 15, arrested after bringing AR-15 and ammunition to a Phoenix high school, police say
SUMMARY: The student is facing “serious felony charges” after allegedly bringing the semi-automatic rifle to Bostrom High School, where he was arrested Friday, the Phoenix Police Department said

TITLE: Ex-Florida officer charged with failing to confront Parkland shooter says he is 'looking forward' to his trial
SUMMARY: Former Broward County sheriff’s deputy Scot Peterson said Monday that the public needs to know he did everything he could as Nikolas Cruz murdered 14 students and three staff members

TITLE: TikTok files lawsuit against Montana over download ban
SUMMARY: The state's ban is a violation of the First Amendment, the social media app says

TITLE: California man who stopped to help family of ducks cross road is killed by car
SUMMARY: The 17-year-old girl who hit Casey Rivara, 41, is unlikely to face criminal charges, officials said

TITLE: Florida tourism thriving after Hurricane Ian, just not everywhere
SUMMARY: 137 million tourists bring Florida roughly $100 billion a year in revenue and support 1.6 million jobs. However, the recovery from Hurricane Ian is at different stages across the state. Our NBC Orlando station WESH-2’s Sanika Dange speaks with Floridians about the mixed recovery stories

TITLE: Lester Holt speaks with Hurricane Ian survivors eight months later
SUMMARY: Eight months after Hurricane Ian barreled into Florida, Lester Holt speaks with survivors, including some of the community’s youngest members, to hear their experiences and how recovery is going

TITLE: 60,000 pounds of an explosive chemical lost during rail shipment, officials say

TITLE: Amazon agrees to pay more than $30 million for alleged privacy violations

TITLE: Man who attacked U.S. Rep. Angie Craig in elevator pleads guilty
SUMMARY: Kendrid Hamlin punched Craig in an elevator, and she threw hot coffee on him and escaped. Capitol Police have said there was no evidence she was targeted because of her position

TITLE: Bill Cosby faces new sexual assault lawsuits after states extend statutes of limitations
SUMMARY: Former Playboy model Victoria Valentino has publicly accused Cosby of drugging and raping her in 1969, and accusers in Nevada plan legal action thanks to "look back window" laws

TITLE: 32 Mississippi school districts still under federal desegregation orders
SUMMARY: The desegregation orders fit into a broader body of civil rights work that is examining jails, police departments and hate crimes in the state, according to the Justice Department

TITLE: Woman who refused tuberculosis treatment is in custody months after an arrest warrant was issued
SUMMARY: The woman, identified in court documents as V.N., was detained and booked into a “negative pressure” room at the Pierce County, Washington, Jail, an official said

TITLE: Attorney accused of rapes in Boston in 2007 and 2008 faces charges
SUMMARY: Matthew Nilo, 35, was arrested Tuesday in New Jersey and will be taken to Massachusetts. He will plead not guilty, his attorney said

TITLE: Days before Iowa building collapsed, engineers warned it could crumble
SUMMARY: Davenport officials said three people are believed to be in the part of the building that collapsed Sunday evening

TITLE: Women more likely than men to skip or delay medications due to cost, CDC report finds
SUMMARY: In 2021, 9.2 million adults said they didn't take a medication as prescribed to save money

TITLE: The U.S. economy added 339,000 jobs in May, once again beating expectations
SUMMARY: The unemployment rate was at 3.7% against the estimate of 3.5%, just above the lowest level since 1969

TITLE: Family finds 1,000,000 pennies inside late father’s home

TITLE: State Department investigating case of detained American in Russia
SUMMARY: “We’ve been seeking to learn more about the apparent detention of Travis Leake," Secretary of State Antony Blinken told reporters Monday

TITLE: Underground Erie Canal boat tour turns deadly in Western New York
SUMMARY: Police are trying to figure out how an underground tour boat along the Erie Canal capsized and turned into a deadly situation in Western New York. Authorities say the boat had 29 adults on board and somehow flipped over in a cave. NBC News’ Jesse Kirsch has the latest

However, critics say the new law puts low-income kids at risk who might be under pressure to make money for their families and therefore vulnerable to exploitation. NBC News’ Stephanie Gosk reports

TITLE: NYC mandates minimum wage for app-based delivery workers
SUMMARY: The mandate, which took effect Monday, will start at $17.96 per hour and increase to $19.96 per hour by 2025

TITLE: 1 person dead after boat capsizes in cave along Erie Canal in New York
SUMMARY: Local travel and hospitality providers were on the boat when it ran into problems in Lockport Cave

TITLE: 'Wheel of Fortune' host Pat Sajak announces he will retire next year
SUMMARY: "It’s been a wonderful ride, and I’ll have more to say in the coming months," the veteran game show host tweeted

TITLE: Chocolate expected to get more expensive as cocoa prices soar to 7-year highs
SUMMARY: Among the different varieties of chocolate, prices of dark will reportedly be the hardest hit

TITLE: Debris from missing Titanic submersible found, passengers presumed dead
SUMMARY: After four days of searching for the missing submersible that was exploring the Titanic’s wreckage, a Canadian deepsea robot spotted debris from the vessel. The five people on board are presumed to be dead. NBC News’ Tom Costello has the latest updates

TITLE: LA video store making a comeback for nostalgic film fanatics
SUMMARY: A group of optimists is staging an unlikely comeback for video stores. NBC News’ Gadi Schwartz takes us to Vidiots in Los Angeles, which is reopening with the help of supporters like “The Morning Show’s” Mark Duplass

TITLE: Massive cricket invasion takes over Nevada town
SUMMARY: A swarm of crickets has invaded the town of Elko, Nevada. NBC News’ Steve Patterson speaks to residents about the impact of the critters’ takeover

TITLE: Oregon county sues fossil fuel companies, alleging they caused deadly 2021 heat wave in Northwest
SUMMARY: The lawsuit from Multnomah County lists 17 defendants and says the heat dome was "a direct and foreseeable consequence" of oil companies’ actions

TITLE: Deion Sanders says he'll have surgery to avoid foot amputation
SUMMARY: Sanders, who has already had two toes amputated, said last week he has no feeling in the bottom of his foot because of circulation issues

TITLE: Lawyer for Ye dismisses 'dystopian' claims about Donda Academy, asks judge to dismiss suit
SUMMARY: Former teachers for the private Christian school have claimed students were fed only sushi and administrators failed to act on accounts of severe bullying

TITLE: He's 7-foot-4. Expectations are high for 1st NBA draft pick Victor Wembanyama.
SUMMARY: The 19-year-old Frenchman — who stands 7-foot-4 — was selected as the first pick in Thursday's draft by the San Antonio Spurs

TITLE: Search Day 4: Titanic submersible debris found, all onboard presumed dead
SUMMARY: The debris found at the seafloor was “consistent with a catastrophic implosion of the vessel,” the Coast Guard said

TITLE: NBA 2023 Draft: Highlights, results and best player moments
SUMMARY: As expected, French phenom Victor Wembanyama went No. 1 to the San Antonio Spurs

TITLE: 2 dead in shooting outside Florida McDonald’s, police say
SUMMARY: Tallahassee police said they were conducting a double homicide investigation after officers responded to the fast-food restaurant Thursday and found two men dead in the parking lot

TITLE: Little-known N.J. baby retailer tentatively wins rights to Buy Buy Baby's IP for $15.5 million
SUMMARY: Dream on Me Industries won last week's auction with a bid price of $15.5 million, court records filed Friday show

TITLE: Texas teen missing for more than 8 years is found alive
SUMMARY: Rudy Farias, now 25, was last seen in 2015 walking two dogs who returned to his Houston home without him

TITLE: Suburban New York police officer accused of making hoax threats against herself
SUMMARY: Emily Hirshowitz, 36, of the Ossining PD has been charged with filing false reports

TITLE: This drag family is out and proud deep in Pennsylvania coal country
SUMMARY: Led by the child of a coal miner, the Daniels drag family is firmly woven in the fabric of a string of Pennsylvania coal-mining towns

TITLE: Couple at New York City hotel opened door expecting Uber Eats, instead found armed robber, lawsuit says
SUMMARY: The gunpoint robbery occurred in a room at the Boro Hotel in Long Island City, Queens, on Jan. 2, 2021, according to the newly field suit

TITLE: Maryland man steals forklift from Lowe's and fatally mows down woman at Home Depot
SUMMARY: Bryce Caleb Timothy Brown, 20, of Waldorf, is charged with first-degree murder, accused of killing 73-year-old Gloristine Pinkney

TITLE: 7 injured when Hawaiian Airlines flight hits turbulent skies on way to Sydney
SUMMARY: A passenger and three flight attendants were "referred for further evaluation," the airline said

TITLE: North Carolina roller coaster ‘Fury 325’ shut down after massive crack was discovered
SUMMARY: A roller coaster called “Fury 325” in Charlotte, North Carolina shut down indefinitely after a father discovered a frightening crack. Meanwhile, another roller coaster in Wisconsin had a mechanical failure and riders were stuck hanging upside down for more than three hours. NBC News’ Sam Brock reports

TITLE: Stranded hiker rescued thanks to iPhone SOS feature
SUMMARY: A stranded hiker in a remote Los Angeles canyon had no service but had her iPhone 14 which has a new SOS feature that allows a 911 call to go via satellite. NBC News’ Erin McLaughlin has more details on the rescue

TITLE: California skiers hitting the slopes this 4th of July due to rare snowy summer conditions
SUMMARY: This holiday weekend, skiers are getting the rare chance to rep their best stars and stripes on the slopes. NBC News’ Maggie Vespa shares more on the rare snowy summer condition on California’s Mammoth Mountain

TITLE: Hollywood actors join writers in historic strike
SUMMARY: Members of SAG-AFTRA, which represents 160,000 actors, will join writers on the picket lines starting this Friday, marking the first joint strike in over 60 years. NBC News’ Dana Griffin has more on the ripple effect that is shaking up Hollywood

TITLE: Texas authorities search field linked to convicted murderer who allegedly confessed to 2 killings and may be connected to more
SUMMARY: Local and federal authorities searched a Texas field north of Austin connected to Raul Meza Jr. on Wednesday

TITLE: AI helping airlines forecast weather to reduce flight delays
SUMMARY: The nation’s airlines are navigating a summer of weather extremes including record heat, rain, tornadoes, lightning and historic flooding. NBC News’ Tom Costello has more details on how artificial intelligence is now helping to micro-forecast the weather to help cut flight delays

TITLE: Latino families with trans minors fear new laws limiting medical treatment: 'It’s what's kept my daughter alive'
SUMMARY: In Texas, a law now bans medical professionals from prescribing drugs to block puberty, hormonal therapies and gender transition surgeries on minors

TITLE: Wanted: Surfboard-stealing sea otter making waves in California
SUMMARY: Wildlife officials looking for a 5-year-old female otter that has shown aggression toward people

TITLE: Arrest made in connection with drug death of Robert DeNiro's grandson
SUMMARY: The body of Leandro Anthony De Niro-Rodriguez, an aspiring 19-year-old actor, was found July 2 in a suspected drug overdose

TITLE: Man drowns in home in Vermont’s 1st recorded flooding death
SUMMARY: It was the second flood-related death stemming from a storm system and epic flooding in the Northeast this week

TITLE: Giant rabid beaver attacks Georgia girl swimming in lake
SUMMARY: The girl’s father beat the beaver to death while rescuing his daughter

TITLE: More than 1 in 4 staffers in these senators' offices are LGBTQ
SUMMARY: Senate Democrats released a staff diversity report Thursday showing the racial, ethnic and gender diversity of their offices

TITLE: Lester Holt reflects on growing up on Alaska military base
SUMMARY: Reporting from Alaska for a special edition of NBC Nightly News, Lester Holt shares his personal memories and reflections of living in the state as a child while his father was stationed at what was then Elmendorf Air Force Base

TITLE: Officer who unleashed K-9 on man during highway stop now on leave
SUMMARY: In a video released by Ohio state highway patrol, a 23-year-old Black man was surrendering to police when a local officer unleashed his K-9 on him. State police say the suspect was driving and an attempted traffic stop turned into a nearly 30-minute pursuit. The officer is now on leave. NBC News’ Jesse Kirsch reports

TITLE: Inside NORAD’s mission to defend U.S. airspace
SUMMARY: Lester Holt reports from Joint Base Elemendorf-Richardson in Alaska, with an inside look at NORAD’s operations as a first line of defense against growing threats from Russia and China

TITLE: Pete Davidson must do public service, attend traffic school after crashing car into Beverly Hills home
SUMMARY: Davidson faced a misdemeanor reckless driving charge following the March 4 incident

TITLE: Michigan Supreme Court expands parental rights in former same-sex relationships
SUMMARY: The case involved a woman seeking parental rights over her former partner's child, who was born while they were in a relationship but before same-sex marriage was legalized

TITLE: 3rd person charged in arson attack on California Planned Parenthood
SUMMARY: An active-duty U.S. Marine and another California man had previously been arrested in connection with the March 13, 2022, attack

TITLE: Authorities search for bear who killed runner near Yellowstone National Park
SUMMARY: The victim was identified as 48-year-old Amie Adamson of Derby, Kansas, a hiker, runner, author, and former teacher

TITLE: 'There was no kidnapping': Carlee Russell apologizes after admitting hoax
SUMMARY: Hoover Police Chief Nicholas C. Derzis said police are consulting with the district attorney’s office regarding potential criminal charges after the 25-year-old's statement

TITLE: Former pastor arrested in 1975 murder of young girl walking to his church
SUMMARY: The murder of 8-year-old Gretchen Harrington shook Marple Township, Pennsylvania, just outside Philadelphia. Authorities say the man recently confessed

TITLE: Social media influencer giveaway results in massive mob in NYC’s Union Square
SUMMARY: Police say at least two thousand people mobbed Union Square in New York City after a social media influencer, known as Kai Cenat, planned an event to give away PlayStations. Cenat is in custody. NBC News’ Ron Allen has more details on the chaos and several arrests made

TITLE: Six Mississippi officers plead guilty to torturing two men for hours
SUMMARY: Six Mississippi law enforcement officers have pleaded guilty to a series of federal charges after investigators say they tortured two men for hours. NBC News’ Miguel Almaguer has more details on the case

TITLE: Victim identified in Gilgo Beach murders investigation
SUMMARY: At least 11 bodies were discovered over a decade ago in the Gilgo Beach murders case and Rex Heuermann is accused of killing three. NBC News’ Stephanie Gosk reports on another breakthrough in the investigation after another victim’s remains were identified

TITLE: Wells Fargo facing new backlash over alleged fraudulent accounts
SUMMARY: Wells Fargo has faced steep fines in the past for accounts opened without customers’ consent. Now, there are new claims of imposters setting up accounts in what appears to be a case of synthetic identity fraud. Wells Fargo says the allegations against the bank are “without merit.” NBC News’ Erin McLaughlin reports

TITLE: Economy added 187,000 jobs in July, unemployment falls to 3.5%
SUMMARY: As the unemployment rate in Minnesota, and nationwide, is near record lows, the search is on to find qualified candidates to fill open positions. NBC News’ Tom Costello traveled to St. Paul to learn more about how one business is growing and trying to meet demand

TITLE: Florida roller coaster closed after boy falls and suffers 'traumatic injuries'
SUMMARY: The injured 6-year-old was found about 20 feet under a the track of a ride at Fun Spot America, Osceola County first responders said

TITLE: Former neighbor said Oregon kidnapping suspect made his previous neighborhood feel unsafe
SUMMARY: The neighbor filed a restraining order against Negasi Zuberi in Washington state, months before he was accused of kidnapping and holding a woman captive

TITLE: Fugitive fraudster caught 'living high on the hog' in Florida 4 years after escape from Colorado prison
SUMMARY: Allen Todd May, 58, carried out a $700,000 oil and gas claims fraud scheme from prison before escaping in December 2018

TITLE: Founder of The Ocean Cleanup is ridding the world of ocean plastic
SUMMARY: When Boyan Slat was 16-years-old he wondered about all of the trash in the ocean, ten years later he founded The Ocean Cleanup. NBC News' Gadi Schwartz speaks with Slat about his work and new ways to clean the ocean.&nbsp

TITLE: Most babies who got very sick from RSV last winter were previously healthy, study finds
SUMMARY: During last winter's RSV season, a majority of infants in intensive care with RSV didn't have any underlying conditions

TITLE: From shocking deaths to murder charges: The events that led to Murdaugh's conviction
SUMMARY: The twisting case engulfing the scion of a prominent legal dynasty in South Carolina's Lowcountry began when he reported finding his wife and son dead in June 2021

TITLE: Pilot vacationing on Maui volunteered to fly plane as fires raged, helping 330 people get off the island
SUMMARY: "Every story we heard from the locals, it was just a sad story. You do whatever you can to help them,” Capt. Vince Eckelkamp said.&nbsp

TITLE: 'The Blind Side' subject Michael Oher says adoption by Tuohy family is a lie, he was cut out of movie money
SUMMARY: The former NFL star alleges that the Tuohys misled him into believing an arrangement he signed was a form of adoption but that it was, in fact, a conservatorship

TITLE: Latino kids in states with more anti-immigrant laws have poorer health, study finds
SUMMARY: A study in Pediatrics found that Latinos from 3 to 17 in states with more discriminatory policies have higher odds of having certain physical and mental health conditions

TITLE: Entire police department in Minnesota city resigns
SUMMARY: The Goodhue City Council discussed options for police coverage after the entire department's resignation

TITLE: Georgia panel rejects recommendation to fire teacher for reading book about gender identity to her students
SUMMARY: Katie Rinderle was removed from her classroom after reading “My Shadow is Purple,” a children's book exploring gender fluidity, to her fifth-grade class

TITLE: 'The Blind Side' family promoted adoption for years. Michael Oher says his was a lie.
SUMMARY: Former NFL star Michael Oher genuinely believed he was a part of the Tuohy family, who became an inspiration to others looking to adopt.&nbsp

TITLE: Maui wildfires: The first twelve hours from eyewitnesses
SUMMARY: NBC News strung together firsthand video accounts showing the progression of wildfires on Aug. 8 in Maui

TITLE: Timeline: How ferocious wildfires devastated Maui, hour by hour
SUMMARY: NBC News has reconstructed a timeline of events in Hawaii, where windswept wildfires ravaged communities and killed scores of people
